definition:
Two different ways of powering blocks which allow signals to travel through blocks.

Hard power - Created when powering a block with a repeater, comparator, torch, observers, levers, pressure plates etc. This allows redstone dust adjacent to that block to be powered as well as repeaters, comparators, lamps, etc.

Soft power - Created when powering a block with redstone dust. Redstone dust adjacent to this block will not be powered, however components such as lamps, comparators, repeaters and torches will still be activated.
